headline: UnitedHealth stock crushed: A timeline of the insurer's last year
summary: According to a Wall Street Journal report, UnitedHealth Group (UNH) is under investigation by the Department of Justice (DOJ) over alleged Medicare fraud. UnitedHealth's stock is under pressure in Thursday's trading session. Yahoo Finance senior health reporter Anjalee Khemlani lays out the timeline of events the health insurer has had to weather, including the sudden departure of CEO Andrew Witty this week, last year's cyberattack, and the killing of Brian Thompson — the chief executive of UnitedHealth's insurance business — in December 2024. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Why UnitedHealth (UNH) Stock Is Trading Lower Today
summary: Shares of health insurance company UnitedHealth (NYSE:UNH) fell 16% in the morning session after the Wall Street Journal reported that the Justice Department was investigating the company for possible Medicare fraud. Such investigations typically trigger investor concern due to the potential for significant financial penalties, legal costs, and reputational damage.

headline: UnitedHealth investigation, Apple production, CoreWeave earnings
summary: UnitedHealth Group (UNH) is being investigated by Justice Department officials (DOJ), according to the Wall Street Journal, over alleged fraud tied to the health insurer's Medicare Advantage business. This comes as UnitedHealth CEO Andrew Witty stepped down earlier this week with former CEO Stephen Hemsley returning to man the chief executive role. President Trump is pushing iPhone maker Apple (AAPL) to begin domestic production of devices and pull out of its investments to build out a plant in India. CoreWeave (CRWV) stock pops on its first earnings report since going public via an IPO. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

raw.headline: UnitedHealth investigation, Apple production, CoreWeave earnings
raw.summary: UnitedHealth Group (UNH) is being investigated by Justice Department officials (DOJ), according to the Wall Street Journal, over alleged fraud tied to the health insurer's Medicare Advantage business. This comes as UnitedHealth CEO Andrew Witty stepped down earlier this week with former CEO Stephen Hemsley returning to man the chief executive role. President Trump is pushing iPhone maker Apple (AAPL) to begin domestic production of devices and pull out of its investments to build out a plant in India. CoreWeave (CRWV) stock pops on its first earnings report since going public via an IPO. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: UnitedHealth shares slide as criminal probe report adds to investor fears
summary: The latest news adds to the health insurer's litany of woes, including multiple government inquiries, a sudden change in top leadership and a pulled outlook in the face of soaring medical costs.  "The stock is already in the doghouse with investors, and additional uncertainty will only pile on," said James Harlow, senior vice president at Novare Capital Management, which owns shares in UnitedHealth.  The company, however, said that it had not been notified by the DOJ regarding this criminal investigation.

raw.headline: UnitedHealth shares slide as criminal probe report adds to investor fears
raw.summary: The latest news adds to the health insurer's litany of woes, including multiple government inquiries, a sudden change in top leadership and a pulled outlook in the face of soaring medical costs.  "The stock is already in the doghouse with investors, and additional uncertainty will only pile on," said James Harlow, senior vice president at Novare Capital Management, which owns shares in UnitedHealth.  The company, however, said that it had not been notified by the DOJ regarding this criminal investigation.

headline: US stock futures dip as tariff truce rally sputters, UnitedHealth falls
summary: (Reuters) -U.S. stock index futures slipped on Thursday as euphoria from the U.S.-China tariff truce tapered off, while UnitedHealth was pressured after a report of a DoJ investigation into the health insurer.  Markets are also keenly awaiting commentary from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, who is scheduled to speak later in the day.  UnitedHealth Group dropped 5.9% after the Wall Street Journal reported that the  U.S. Department of Justice was conducting a criminal investigation into the health insurer for possible Medicare fraud.

Markets are also keenly awaiting commentary from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, who is scheduled to speak later in the day.  UnitedHealth Group dropped 5.9% after the Wall Street Journal reported that the  U.S. Department of Justice was conducting a criminal investigation into the health insurer for possible Medicare fraud.

headline: Indian IT firm Persistent Systems drops after report that key client UnitedHealth faces criminal probe
summary: The U.S. Department of Justice's healthcare-fraud unit is overseeing the criminal investigation, which focuses on UnitedHealth's Medicare Advantage business practices, the Wall Street Journal had reported.  UnitedHealth is one of Persistent Systems' top five clients and has an "over $100 million relationship" with the company, said Rahul Jain, an IT analyst at Dolat Capital.
